<ce:section-title>Synthesis</ce:section-title><ce:section-title>Synthesis of di-3-pyridyl ketone (L)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">Under the protection of N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>, 3-bromopyridine (1.58<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in 10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml anhydrous diethyl ether was added slowly into 6.3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml (10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) <ce:italic>n</ce:italic>-butyllithium (15% in hexane) in 15<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml anhydrous diethyl ether at −78<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C. The resulting solution was kept at −78<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C for 30<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>min, and then 1.37<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g (10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) methyl nicotinate in 15<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml anhydrous diethyl ether was added slowly within 20<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>min with vigorous stirring. After stirring at −78<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C for another 30<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>min, the solution was allowed to warm slowly to −20<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C over 3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h, after which it was further quenched with 15<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml HCl solution in water and methanol (water/methanol/conc. HCl=5:5:1). The mixture was extracted with dichloromethane, and the combined organic extract was dried over anhydrous sodium sulfate and finally concentrated in vacuo to give an orange–yellow solid. Purification by chromatography on silica-<ce:italic>gel</ce:italic> using ethyl acetate/hexane as the eluent gave 1.4<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>L as a white solid in 76% yield, m.p. 115.8–116.3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C. <ce:sup loc="pre">1</ce:sup>H NMR (300<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>MHz, CDCl<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>): <ce:italic>δ</ce:italic> 9.01 (d, <ce:italic>J</ce:italic>=1.5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Hz, 2H), 8.85 (dd, <ce:italic>J</ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">1</ce:inf>=1.2, <ce:italic>J</ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>=4.8<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Hz, 2H), 8.14 (dt, <ce:italic>J</ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">1</ce:inf>=7.8, <ce:italic>J</ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>=1.8<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Hz, 2H), 7.49 (dd, <ce:italic>J</ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">1</ce:inf>=4.8, <ce:italic>J</ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>=7.8<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Hz, 2H), IR (KBr): 1651s, 1581s, 1473w, 1416s, 1333m, 1294s, 1193w, 1143w, 1113w, 1083w, 1018w, 931m, 845w, 812w, 729s, 696m, 667w, 621w, 567w cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>; MS <ce:italic>m</ce:italic>/<ce:italic>z</ce:italic>: 184.06 ([<ce:italic>MH</ce:italic>]<ce:sup loc="post">+</ce:sup>, 100% relative abundance); Anal. for C<ce:inf loc="post">11</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O: Calcd. C 71.73, H 4.38, N 15.20; Found C 71.69, H 4.34, N 15.19.</ce:para><ce:section-title>Synthesis of [AgL(BF<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>)]<ce:inf loc="post">∞</ce:inf> (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">AgBF<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf> (40<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 0.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) and L (37<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 0.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) were dissolved in 5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml CH<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>OH with stirring at room temperature. A white precipitate formed immediately, which was dissolved by the addition of CH<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>CN. After filtration, the solution was placed in the dark for a week to give light yellow crystals of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>. Yield: 73%. Anal. for C<ce:inf loc="post">11</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>BF<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>OAg: Calcd. C 34.87, H 2.13, N 7.39; Found C 35.03, H 2.16, N 7.42. IR (KBr): 1653s, 1585s, 1477w, 1419m, 1333m, 1298s, 1196w, 1119s, 1080s, 1034s, 931m, 843w, 814w, 721m, 698m, 671w, 623w, 525w cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>.</ce:para><ce:section-title>Synthesis of [AgL(ClO<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>)]<ce:inf loc="post">∞</ce:inf> (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">This complex was obtained as light-yellow crystals in a similar manner as for <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> by the reaction of AgClO<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf> with L. Yield: 80%. Anal. for C<ce:inf loc="post">11</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>ClN<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf>Ag: Calcd. C 33.75, H 2.06, N 7.15; Found C 33.80, H 2.05, N 7.17. IR (KBr): 1653s, 1585s, 1477w, 1419m, 1333w, 1298s, 1143s, 1113s, 1088s, 1022w, 933w, 842w, 814w, 729m, 698m, 671w, 627m, 571w<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>.</ce:para><ce:section-title>Synthesis of [AgL(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)]<ce:inf loc="post">∞</ce:inf> (<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">AgNO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> (34<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 0.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) and L (37<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 0.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) were dissolved in a mixed solvent of 3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml CH<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>CN and 3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml CH<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>OH with stirring at room temperature. The solution was stirred overnight in the dark, filtered, and allowed to stay in the dark for two weeks to give light-yellow crystals of <ce:bold>3</ce:bold>. Yield: 77%. Anal. for C<ce:inf loc="post">11</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>Ag: Calcd. C 37.31, H 2.28, N 11.86; Found C 37.23, H 2.25, N 11.82. IR (KBr): 1651s, 1583s, 1416s, 1383vs, 1294s, 1193w, 1115w, 1020w, 930w, 841w, 823w, 729m, 698m, 669w, 621w<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>.</ce:para><ce:section-title>Synthesis of [AgL(CF<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>SO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)]<ce:inf loc="post">∞</ce:inf> (<ce:bold>4</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">This complex was synthesized in the same way as for <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> by the reaction of AgSO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>CF<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> with L. Yield: 63%. Anal. for C<ce:inf loc="post">12</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>F<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>SAg: Calcd. C 32.67, H 1.83, N 6.35; Found C 32.82, H 1.83, N 6.32. IR (KBr): 1653s, 1585s, 1475w, 1417m, 1333m, 1294brs, 1174m, 1117w, 1082w, 1034s, 935m, 843w, 813w, 760w, 729m, 698m, 646m, 575w, 519w<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>.</ce:para><ce:section-title>Synthesis of [AgL(PF<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>)]<ce:inf loc="post">∞</ce:inf> (<ce:bold>5</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">This complex was prepared using the same method as for <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> by the reaction of L with AgPF<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf> in 1:1 molar ratio. Yield: 82%. Anal. for C<ce:inf loc="post">11</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>F<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>OPAg: Calcd. C 30.23, H 1.85, N 6.41; Found C 30.26, H 1.88, N 6.30. IR (KBr): 1655s, 1585s, 1477w, 1419s, 1335m, 1298s, 1250w, 1203w, 1117w, 1022w, 937m, 835brs, 731s, 698m, 671w, 621w, 559s<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>.</ce:para>
clean_text:
Synthesis

Synthesis of di-3-pyridyl ketone (L)

Under the protection of N2, 3-bromopyridine (1.58g, 10mmol) in 10ml anhydrous diethyl ether was added slowly into 6.3ml (10mmol) n-butyllithium (15% in hexane) in 15ml anhydrous diethyl ether at -78°C. The resulting solution was kept at -78°C for 30min, and then 1.37g (10mmol) methyl nicotinate in 15ml anhydrous diethyl ether was added slowly within 20min with vigorous stirring. After stirring at -78°C for another 30min, the solution was allowed to warm slowly to -20°C over 3h, after which it was further quenched with 15ml HCl solution in water and methanol (water/methanol/conc. HCl=5:5:1). The mixture was extracted with dichloromethane, and the combined organic extract was dried over anhydrous sodium sulfate and finally concentrated in vacuo to give an orange-yellow solid. Purification by chromatography on silica-gel using ethyl acetate/hexane as the eluent gave 1.4gL as a white solid in 76% yield, m.p. 115.8-116.3°C. 1H NMR (300MHz, CDCl3): δ 9.01 (d, J=1.5Hz, 2H), 8.85 (dd, J 1=1.2, J 2=4.8Hz, 2H), 8.14 (dt, J 1=7.8, J 2=1.8Hz, 2H), 7.49 (dd, J 1=4.8, J 2=7.8Hz, 2H), IR (KBr): 1651s, 1581s, 1473w, 1416s, 1333m, 1294s, 1193w, 1143w, 1113w, 1083w, 1018w, 931m, 845w, 812w, 729s, 696m, 667w, 621w, 567w cm-1; MS m/z: 184.06 ([MH]+, 100% relative abundance); Anal. for C11H8N2O: Calcd. C 71.73, H 4.38, N 15.20; Found C 71.69, H 4.34, N 15.19.

Synthesis of [AgL(BF4)]∞ (1)

AgBF4 (40mg, 0.2mmol) and L (37mg, 0.2mmol) were dissolved in 5ml CH3OH with stirring at room temperature. A white precipitate formed immediately, which was dissolved by the addition of CH3CN. After filtration, the solution was placed in the dark for a week to give light yellow crystals of 1. Yield: 73%. Anal. for C11H8BF4N2OAg: Calcd. C 34.87, H 2.13, N 7.39; Found C 35.03, H 2.16, N 7.42. IR (KBr): 1653s, 1585s, 1477w, 1419m, 1333m, 1298s, 1196w, 1119s, 1080s, 1034s, 931m, 843w, 814w, 721m, 698m, 671w, 623w, 525w cm-1.

Synthesis of [AgL(ClO4)]∞ (2)

This complex was obtained as light-yellow crystals in a similar manner as for 1 by the reaction of AgClO4 with L. Yield: 80%. Anal. for C11H8ClN2O5Ag: Calcd. C 33.75, H 2.06, N 7.15; Found C 33.80, H 2.05, N 7.17. IR (KBr): 1653s, 1585s, 1477w, 1419m, 1333w, 1298s, 1143s, 1113s, 1088s, 1022w, 933w, 842w, 814w, 729m, 698m, 671w, 627m, 571wcm-1.

Synthesis of [AgL(NO3)]∞ (3)

AgNO3 (34mg, 0.2mmol) and L (37mg, 0.2mmol) were dissolved in a mixed solvent of 3ml CH3CN and 3ml CH3OH with stirring at room temperature. The solution was stirred overnight in the dark, filtered, and allowed to stay in the dark for two weeks to give light-yellow crystals of 3. Yield: 77%. Anal. for C11H8N3O4Ag: Calcd. C 37.31, H 2.28, N 11.86; Found C 37.23, H 2.25, N 11.82. IR (KBr): 1651s, 1583s, 1416s, 1383vs, 1294s, 1193w, 1115w, 1020w, 930w, 841w, 823w, 729m, 698m, 669w, 621wcm-1.

Synthesis of [AgL(CF3SO3)]∞ (4)

This complex was synthesized in the same way as for 1 by the reaction of AgSO3CF3 with L. Yield: 63%. Anal. for C12H8F3N2O4SAg: Calcd. C 32.67, H 1.83, N 6.35; Found C 32.82, H 1.83, N 6.32. IR (KBr): 1653s, 1585s, 1475w, 1417m, 1333m, 1294brs, 1174m, 1117w, 1082w, 1034s, 935m, 843w, 813w, 760w, 729m, 698m, 646m, 575w, 519wcm-1.

Synthesis of [AgL(PF6)]∞ (5)

This complex was prepared using the same method as for 1 by the reaction of L with AgPF6 in 1:1 molar ratio. Yield: 82%. Anal. for C11H8F6N2OPAg: Calcd. C 30.23, H 1.85, N 6.41; Found C 30.26, H 1.88, N 6.30. IR (KBr): 1655s, 1585s, 1477w, 1419s, 1335m, 1298s, 1250w, 1203w, 1117w, 1022w, 937m, 835brs, 731s, 698m, 671w, 621w, 559scm-1.

processes.quenching solution: 15 mL HCl solution in water and methanol (water/methanol/conc. HCl=5:5:1)
